result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J Weyker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: With Huber.  Release for standard conditions.  Sentence credit of 6 days was granted.  Straight time if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to restitution.  Remaining balance to Immanuel Luther Church and to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Disclose to any physician in writing your conditions of probation on this case.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  
16CF383 is dismissed and read in.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber.  Non-working hours with standard release conditions.  Commencing 8/23/16 at 6:00 p.m.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brandon J Weyker in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Winter makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

12 months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 6 days).  

Term of Probation: 3 Years

Conditions of Probation:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

Inform agent of all prescriptions;

Disclose to any physician in writing your conditions of probation

Condition Time: 20 days Huber with NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence Tuesday 8/23/2016 @ 6pm

Restitution: $544.00 to Immanuel Luther Church, to be paid as a condition of probation. Bail to be applied. 

COSTS:  $278.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on August 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Received June 16, 2016, dated June 15, 2016 from ADA Hulgaard, adjournment request
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.

Jury status hearing on June 30, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Cases 16CF383 and 15CF1126 called.  Defendant Brandon J Weyker in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to case #16CF383:  Preliminary Hearing waived.  Information filed.  Attorney Winter waives formal reading.  NOT GUILTY plea entered.  Information filed. Court addresses the bad WCS report.  Court sets 15CF1126 for trial.  The new case is set for a hearing.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 09:30 am.
